document_data.name: Jolen Firth
document_data.mainbody: '''Jolen Firth''' was the First Speaker of [[Nesmé]] in the late 15th century.
document_data.Description: Jolen was a sturdy man. He was quite reasonable, in comparison to his forefathers.
document_data.Relationships: Jolen Firth's grandfather's grandfather (great-great-grandfather) was [[Galen Firth]], another prominent man in the history of the city.
document_data.History: In [[1484 DR]], Jolen Firth was serving as the First Speaker of Nesmé when his city was cast under siege by the [[orc]]s of the [[Kingdom of Many-Arrows]]. The [[Companions of the Hall]] aided him and his forces in defending the city, but soon after the Companions' departure, the city was overcome by the orc forces and the [[white dragon]] [[Arauthator]]. All but 600 of the inhabitants were killed; the rest were taken prisoner. The [[drow]] [[Tiago Baenre|Tiago]] and [[Saribel Baenre]] were named Duke and Duchess of Nesme, and Tiago sentenced Jolen to be crucified in front of the city's main gate.
